messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html File doc/gccgo_contribute.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html#newcode8 doc/gccgo_contribute.html:8: These are some notes on contributing to the gccgo frontend for GCC. what is it called? gccgo? gccgo? GCCGO? you seem to have chosen gccgo, which is fine but looks odd when GCC is the thing it's built on. it's entirely up to you, but tell us how it should be spelled and we'll make sure to be consistent. and you should be consistent here; there are still a number of the variants. http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html#newcode43 doc/gccgo_contribute.html:43: Changes to these directories always flow from the master sources to "master sources" is undefined http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html#newcode67 doc/gccgo_contribute.html:67: changes should be made in the main Go repository. The files outside c.f. master sources? http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html#newcode85 doc/gccgo_contribute.html:85: main Go repository are run using the DejaGNU script found in s/are/is/

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=a3e2c790db24 ***

doc: update gccgo_contribute.html

R=golang-dev, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080

PTAL http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html File doc/gccgo_contribute.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html#newcode8 doc/gccgo_contribute.html:8: These are some notes on contributing to the gccgo frontend for GCC. On 2012/02/17 07:16:19, r wrote: > what is it called? gccgo? gccgo? GCCGO? > you seem to have chosen gccgo, which is fine but looks odd when GCC is the thing > it's built on. > > it's entirely up to you, but tell us how it should be spelled and we'll make > sure to be consistent. and you should be consistent here; there are still a > number of the variants. Yeah, I agree it's inconsistent right now. I'm open to suggestions, but right now I think the project should be called gccgo (capitalized at the start of a sentence) and the program, in usage examples or other specific references, should be called gccgo. The GCC project is these days usually called "GCC" rather than "gcc", but I think I would rather write "gccgo" than "GCCGO". I cleaned this up in the rest of the doc. http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html#newcode43 doc/gccgo_contribute.html:43: Changes to these directories always flow from the master sources to On 2012/02/17 07:16:19, r wrote: > "master sources" is undefined Done. http://codereview.appspot.com/5673080/diff/1/doc/gccgo_contribute.html#newcode85 doc/gccgo_contribute.html:85: main Go repository are run using the DejaGNU script found in On 2012/02/17 07:16:19, r wrote: > s/are/is/ Done.
